result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua M. Barforth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
**Joint and several with Joshua Aldinger - Case Nos 15CF277 & 15CF278**

2/12/16:  Per 2nd Amended Motion and Order for Restitution and Surcharge filed 02/10/16, court orders amended restitution for Thomas F. Luedeke in the amount of $3,104.48 plus surcharges.
**2nd AMENDED RESTITUTION ATTACHED - filed 01/27/16**

If sentence is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Additional restitution to be determined by the District Attorney within 30 days or deemed waived, any objections to be filed within 10 days of notice of determination.

No contact with victims or co-defendant.    No use or consumption of intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample to the Winnebago County Sheriff immediatley upon request.

supervisions.notes: Readins: 15CM778, 15CF235, 15CF241,15CF290.  Uncharged readins: OPD 15-13323 and WCSD 15-1306.
